tool.name: Du Novo: Make consensus reads

param.name: min_reads
param.label: Minimum reads per family
param.help: Single-strand families with fewer than this many reads will be skipped.

param.name: cons_thres
param.label: Consensus % threshold
param.help: The consensus base must be present in more than this fraction of the reads, or "N" will be used.

param.name: min_cons_reads
param.label: Minimum number of reads for a consensus base.
param.help: If no base at the position appears in at least this many reads, "N" will be used.

param.name: qual_thres
param.label: Minimum base quality
param.help: Bases with a PHRED score less than this will not be counted in the consensus making.

param.name: qual_format
param.label: FASTQ format
param.help: Solexa should also work for Illumina 1.3+ and 1.5+, and Sanger should work for Illumina 1.8+

param.name: keep_sscs
param.label: Output single-strand consensus sequences as well

param.name: phone
param.label: Send usage data
param.help: Report helpful usage data to the developer, to better understand the use cases and performance of the tool. The only data which will be recorded is the name and version of the tool, the size of the input data, the number of processes used, the time and memory taken to process it, and the IP address of the machine running it. Also, if the tool fails, it will report the name of the exception thrown and the line of code it occurred in. The parameters and input/output dataset names are not sent. All the reporting and recording code is available at https://github.com/NickSto/ET.

tool.help:
**What it does**
This is for processing duplex sequencing data. It creates single-strand and duplex consensus reads from aligned read families.
-----
**Input**
This expects the output format of the "Align families" tool.
-----
**Output**
This will output final, duplex consensus reads in two FASTA files (first and second reads in the pairs). Optionally, you can save the single-strand reads too, in a separate FASTA file.
